page.title: 17Recreation (2)
page.content: Use of the countryside for recreation by large numbers of ordinary people is a recent change brought about by the availability of relatively cheap transport to townspeople . Little of our area is available to the public , but its northern edge includes part of one of the most modern developments , the country park . Motorists from nearby towns come to its car-parks , and on any fine Sunday , winter or summer , many people are found on the public footpaths of the area , enjoying the fresh air and long views provided by the rolling hills . Many make Farley Mount Monument , on the very edge of our area the object of their walk . It commemorates an eighteenth century hunting incident and commands a particularly fine panorama .
